overview: The purpose of this measure is to: (1) Establish the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund to facilitate the administration of conference center programs among various campuses and operating units of the University of Hawaii System; (2) Repeal the Conference Center Revolving Fund for the University of Hawaii at Hilo and Community College Conference Center Revolving Fund and lapse all unencumbered funds to the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund; and (3) Appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [6] [6] [6] The University of Hawai‘i (UH) supports HB 1169 HD1, Relating to University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [5] This bill would create one UH Conference Center Revolving Fund and each campus would have accounts within this overarching fund, which would allow all campuses to standardize conference center programs across all campuses while eliminating unnecessary duplication of statutes. [5] [5]
appropriations: A purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [6]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: A key update to the measure is the added purpose to appropriate funds out of the University of Hawaii Conference Center Revolving Fund. [6] The Committee on Finance received testimony in support of this measure from the University of Hawaiʻi System and recommends that H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1, pass Third Reading. [6] [6] The previous version's effective date of July 1, 3000, is not included in the documentation for H.B. No. 1169, H.D. 1. [6]
